Text: You've already scheduled a message to be delivered!
Your message will be delivered at\n%1.\nIs that correct?
The settings for %1 have been changed.\n\nClick OK to start the game as %2.
Go to File -> Save As..., save this game, and send the save file to the other players via email or another transfer service.

Go to File -> Save As..., save this game, and send the save file to the %1 player via email or another transfer service.

IMPORTANT: Do NOT close this window or resume the game before saving, or you will have to replay your turn.
%1, enter your password to start turn %2:
Your turn is almost over. Give any last orders to your units as needed. When you're ready, start the clock to end your turn.
You are starting a PBEM game of %1.\n\nDo you want to use the recommended settings?
The minute must be a number between 00 and 59. Try again?
You can't open a PBEM game in Editor mode until the scenario has ended.\n\nPlay this scenario using Start New Game or Load Saved Game from the main menu.
Passwords didn't match! Please enter your password again:
You've already given orders for this phase. Start the clock to continue executing them.
How long from now should the message be delivered?\nFORMAT: hh:mm:ss
The second must be a number between 00 and 59. Try again?
Your posture toward %1 is %2. What is your new posture?\n\nOptions: FRIENDLY, NEUTRAL, UNFRIENDLY, HOSTILE

This is the %1 setup phase.

Leave the game paused until you've finished setting up your loadouts and missions.

When you're done, click Play to end your turn.
Changes your posture toward a side. Useful if you've accidentally attacked some civilians and don't want them to be hostile anymore.

Sends a message to another player, to be delivered at a time you schedule. Note that the maximum message length is 280 characters, HTML tags will be removed, and that you can only schedule one message for delivery at a time.
Sends a message to another player, to be delivered at the start of their next turn. Note that the maximum message length is 280 characters, and that HTML tags will be removed.
Display the remaining time before your PBEM turn ends.
Give orders to your units as needed. When you're ready, start the clock to execute them.
ERROR: You're using CMO build %1, but this PBEM game was created with %2. All players must use the same build.
Your version of CMO (%1) is outdated. Please upgrade to build %2 or later to play this PBEM scenario.
(The game has been automatically updated to CMO build %1.)
Please save a backup first, then RUN this tool again.
Clear any existing missions for the %1 side?
Welcome to IKE v%1! This tool adds PBEM/hotseat play to any Command: Modern Operations scenario.\n\nRunning this tool cannot be undone. Have you saved a backup of this scenario?
HOW MANY order phases will the %1 side have per turn? (Minimum: 2)
Do you want to PREVENT players from opening the game in EDITOR MODE until it's over?
Should the game start with a SETUP PHASE?

Success! Your PBEM/hotseat scenario has been initialized. Go to FILE -> SAVE AS... to save it under a new name. It will be ready to play when next loaded.

(If you're planning to publish it to the Steam Workshop, you should do it now, before you close this scenario.)

Thanks for using IKE!
Enter the TURN LENGTH in minutes:
Should players be able to give UNLIMITED orders during a turn?\n(Click No for a LIMITED number of order phases per turn.)
ERROR: The turn length must be greater than 0!
You can't offer a draw in the Setup Phase.
Would you like to offer a draw to the other player?
You have offered a draw. The other player will choose whether to accept on their next turn.
You have already offered a draw this turn.
The other player has offered a draw. Do you accept? If YES, the match will end with no winner.
Are you sure you want to accept a draw?
Are you sure you want to resign?
Ends the match immediately in defeat for your side.
Offers to end the match in a draw. If accepted by the other player, the match will end with no winner.
Changes your password. Useful if you want to show the turn to another player, but don't want to reveal your normal password.
